intro: Ebenidium longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed ebony moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and robust, elongated stems that often grow in dense mats on rocky substrates. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth, glossy surface and a distinct midrib. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or among rocks in temperate regions. This plant plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
